page.title: 05DOMESDAY BIDSTON
page.content: Background. The{Domesday Project}of {1086}tells us of a{Hamon de Mascy}who paid a tax of "7 hides" to{Eastham} township.There is only one name of{de {Mascy}in{Cheshire}at that time,and later the{de Mascy}family became lords of{Bidston}.Thus it is likely that we have found the first official reference to{BIDSTON}. In{1320}a{Maud Warwyck}was charged with obstructing the road from Woodchurch to{Bedeston}.In{1347}the {Earl of Lancaster}enclosed 6 acres of land at{Bidston}.In{1397,John Stanley, founder of the{Derby}family,bought the land.In{1544}eight bowmen from Bidston were mustered at{Chester}. In{1680}the lands were sold to{Sir {Robert Vyner}whose family lived at {Bidston Hall}until the 1960's.
